_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Lone Star Bakery, Plant No. 2, located in China Grove, Texas, provides refrigeration for frozen cakes, pies, and other baked goods.  Lone Star Bakery's senior management is not only committed to offer superior service, but also maintain a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities.  Lone Star Bakery administers safety and environmental policies at the facility to ensure compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP).  These programs include forklift safety, hazard communications, lockout/tagout, Hazardous Materials Emergency Business Plan, employee safety manuals, manufacturers documentation, and the Emergency Response Plan.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



Lone Star Bakery is located at 8100 Highway 87 East, China Grove, Texas 78263.  The system was designed and constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations.



The system uses 29,960 pounds of ammonia to provide refrigeration for frozen cakes, pies, and other baked goods.  The majority of the system including vessels and compressors is located within facility walls.  The condensers are mounted on a stand alone platform outside the engine room and all of the evaporators are located in their respective freezer/cold storage areas.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Lone Star Bakery ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system.    For example, Lone Star Bakery operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.



Other safety features of the ammonia refrigeration system include: ammonia sensors that sound an alarm, an emergency shut down button that shuts down the engine room equipment,

relief valves on all pressure vessels, and continuous ventilation in the engine room to prevent ammonia explosions.



In addition to the Uniform Mechanical Code, the facility has based its maintenance program on the industry standard: the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) guidelines.  In particular, the IIAR Bulletin 110, "Startup, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems" is used at the facility.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



An investigation into Lone Star Bakery's accident history showed that there had been one (1) reportable ammonia release over the past five years (July 2011 - July 2016) that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantity of 100 pounds.  This release occurred on May 10, 2015, at 03:15 AM, and lasted for approximately 45 minutes. Approximately 1966 pounds of ammonia leaked from the refrigeration system. There were no injuries, property damages, or offsite impacts that resulted from this incident.The incident was reported to the EPA.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Lone Star Bakery has an emergency response plan in effect at the facility.  The Emergency Response Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of the PSM document, which is maintained at the facility.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:



  1.)  To save lives.

  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.

  3.)  To protect the environment.

  4.)  To minimize property damage.



Lone Star Bakery has members that are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards,which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan will be reviewed and updated as required to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations, as well as to incorporate any facility changes due to the renovation of the facility.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IM

PROVE SAFETY



The Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) performed on November 9-10, 2015, generated mitigation measures (recommendations) to improve safety at the Lone Star Bakery facility located at 8100 Highway 87 East, China Grove, Texas 78263.  Lone Star Bakery has completed all of the recommendations, in a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees.
